name: Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations
goal: The Federation of European Motorcyclists' Associations (FEMA) is the European federation of national road rider organisations. FEMA represents, defends and promotes motorcycling and the interests of million of powered two-wheeler users across Europe. Through its 22 national organisations from 17 countries, FEMA reaches 270,000 dedicated motorcyclists representing all social groups.
interests: Consumers, Energy, Environment, Single market, Taxation, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: EU transport policy, EU road safety strategy, PPE, C-ITS, ADAS, (semi-)automatic driving, urban mobility, EU and UN environment policy, EU energy policy, energy transition, driving licences, sound emissions, EU and UN technical demands regulations, General Safety Regulation, review of the Road Infrastructure Safety Management Directive
